title.value: Summary of the fourth international workshop on deep learning for testing and testing for deep learning (DeepTest 2023)
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly mentioned at the top of the document.
title.quote: Summary of the fourth international workshop on deep learning for testing and testing for deep learning (DeepTest 2023)

extractions.description: The paper summarizes the events, keynotes, and research papers presented at the fourth DeepTest workshop, focusing on the intersection of deep learning and software engineering, particularly in the context of testing deep learning systems and using deep learning for software testing.

type.justification: The paper reports on empirical findings and presentations from the workshop, including summaries of research papers and keynotes.
type.quote: In particular, we welcome submissions that investigate: • How to ensure the quality of DL-based applications, both at model level and system level. • The use of DL to support software engineering tasks, particularly software testing.

name.justification: The primary research field is the application of deep learning techniques within the domain of software engineering, as evidenced by the paper's focus on testing deep learning systems and using deep learning for software testing.
name.quote: DeepTest is a high-quality workshop for research at the intersection of Deep Learning (DL) and Software Engineering (SE).

name.justification: The paper discusses various methods and approaches to testing software systems, particularly those based on deep learning models.
name.quote: DL is widely adopted in modern software systems, including safety-critical domains, such as autonomous cars, medical diagnosis, and aircraft collision avoidance systems. It is crucial to rigorously test such applications to ensure high reliability and safety.

name.justification: Various machine learning models and techniques are mentioned throughout the paper, demonstrating the application of machine learning within the context of software engineering.
name.quote: Gao et al. [2] address the problem of testing for DL-based machine translation models using metamorphic testing.

name.justification: AutoFuzz is a grammar-based black-box fuzzing technique mentioned in the paper, used for generating failure-inducing scenarios for Autonomous Driving Systems.
name.quote: It covers their recent efforts in automatically generating critical test-driving scenarios using three techniques: (1) AutoFuzz [6], a grammar-based black-box fuzzing technique to generate failure-inducing scenarios for Autonomous Driving Systems (ADSs)

is_contributed.justification: AutoFuzz is referenced as part of the keynotes summarizing previous research, not as a new contribution of this workshop.
is_contributed.quote: It covers their recent efforts in automatically generating critical test-driving scenarios using three techniques: (1) AutoFuzz [6], a grammar-based black-box fuzzing technique to generate failure-inducing scenarios for Autonomous Driving Systems (ADSs)

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention that AutoFuzz was executed during the workshop.
is_executed.quote: It covers their recent efforts in automatically generating critical test-driving scenarios using three techniques: (1) AutoFuzz [6], a grammar-based black-box fuzzing technique to generate failure-inducing scenarios for Autonomous Driving Systems (ADSs)

is_compared.justification: The paper does not mention a comparative analysis involving AutoFuzz.
is_compared.quote: It covers their recent efforts in automatically generating critical test-driving scenarios using three techniques: (1) AutoFuzz [6], a grammar-based black-box fuzzing technique to generate failure-inducing scenarios for Autonomous Driving Systems (ADSs)

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title provides context about the origin and scope of AutoFuzz.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Neural network guided evolutionary fuzzing for finding traffic violations of autonomous vehicles.

name.justification: FusED is an evolutionary and causality-based grey-box fuzzing technique for generating critical scenarios for fusion components of autonomous driving systems.
name.quote: (2) FusED [5], an evolutionary and causality-based grey-box fuzzing technique to generate critical scenarios for fusion component of ADSs

is_contributed.justification: FusED is referenced as part of the keynotes summarizing previous research, not as a new contribution of this workshop.
is_contributed.quote: (2) FusED [5], an evolutionary and causality-based grey-box fuzzing technique to generate critical scenarios for fusion component of ADSs

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention that FusED was executed during the workshop.

name.justification: CTG is a conditional diffusion model for generating realistic and user-controllable scenarios for autonomous driving systems.
name.quote: (3) CTG [7], a conditional diffusion model that generates realistic and user-controllable scenarios for ADSs.

is_contributed.justification: CTG is referenced as part of the keynotes summarizing previous research, not as a new contribution of this workshop.

name.justification: DeepPatch is a method for repairing Deep Neural Networks by improving accuracy on corrupted images while minimizing the impact on clean images.
name.quote: They presented DeepPatch, a patching-based DNN repair method that improves the DNN’s accuracy on corrupted images while avoiding too much impact on clean images.

is_contributed.justification: DeepPatch is referenced in summaries of paper presentations, not as a new contribution of this workshop.
is_contributed.quote: Bu and Sun [1] address the problem of repairing DL models, especially for Deep Neural Networks (DNNs), when the original training data is not available. They presented DeepPatch, a patching-based DNN repair method that improves the DNN’s accuracy on corrupted images while avoiding too much impact on clean images.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention that DeepPatch was executed during the workshop.
is_executed.quote: Bu and Sun [1] address the problem of repairing DL models, especially for Deep Neural Networks (DNNs), when the original training data is not available. They presented DeepPatch, a patching-based DNN repair method that improves the DNN’s accuracy on corrupted images while avoiding too much impact on clean images.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not provide a comparative analysis involving DeepPatch.
is_compared.quote: Bu and Sun [1] address the problem of repairing DL models, especially for Deep Neural Networks (DNNs), when the original training data is not available. They presented DeepPatch, a patching-based DNN repair method that improves the DNN’s accuracy on corrupted images while avoiding too much impact on clean images.

name.justification: DeepSHAP is mentioned in the context of explaining the distribution of explanation signatures for adversarial example detection in DL models.
name.quote: Lin and Yu [3] discuss the interpretability of DL models using decision logic. They showed that there is a different distribution of DL model explanation signatures (e.g., SHAP) between normal and adversarial examples, as well as diverse decision logic of networks to distinguish them.

is_contributed.justification: DeepSHAP is referenced in summaries of paper presentations, not as a new contribution of this workshop.
is_contributed.quote: Lin and Yu [3] discuss the interpretability of DL models using decision logic. They showed that there is a different distribution of DL model explanation signatures (e.g., SHAP) between normal and adversarial examples, as well as diverse decision logic of networks to distinguish them.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention that DeepSHAP was executed during the workshop.
